feedback_items.issue: No concise professional summary that frames current career focus for AI/MLOps roles.
feedback_items.recommendation: Add a 1–2 line professional summary under the name/title that highlights immediate focus areas (cloud infra, CI/CD, MLOps-adjacent tooling) and the value you bring.
feedback_items.example_rewrite: DevOps Engineer focused on AWS infrastructure, CI/CD modernisation (GitHub Actions), and enabling reproducible AI experimentation through IaC (Pulumi) and automated pipelines.

feedback_items.issue: Missing key AI-engineering / MLOps keywords that ATS and hiring managers expect (e.g., Docker, model serving, registries, monitoring).
feedback_items.recommendation: If you have experience with these, add them to Skills as distinct entries (Docker, MLflow/SageMaker/ML registries, Prometheus/Grafana, model serving frameworks). If not, avoid listing unfamiliar tools.
feedback_items.example_rewrite:
Skills
- Containers & Runtime: Docker
- Model Ops: MLflow, SageMaker, model registry (add only if experienced)
- Observability: Prometheus, Grafana, CloudWatch

feedback_items.issue: Residual date inconsistency and a future-dated role (DDD PERTH — September 2025) may confuse ATS/recruiters.
feedback_items.recommendation: Confirm the correct date for the volunteer role and correct it to past or present as appropriate; use a standardized format (e.g., 'Sep 2025' or 'Sep 2025 – Present').
feedback_items.example_rewrite: DDD PERTH — Volunteer Team Lead | Sep 2023 – Present (confirm actual dates)

feedback_items.issue: Many bullets show positive outcomes but lack ownership and scale context (team size, number of services, frequency of deployments).
feedback_items.recommendation: Where possible, add concise scope/scale metrics to strengthen impact statements (services affected, team size, deployment cadence).
feedback_items.example_rewrite: Led CI/CD migration for ~[N] microservices, enabling daily deployments and reducing mean time to release by ~30%.

feedback_items.issue: AI / ML project descriptions are brief and do not state model infra details (training scale, inference serving, monitoring or experiment tracking).
feedback_items.recommendation: Expand project bullets to name frameworks/tools used for training, serving, experiment tracking and any measurable result or validation.
feedback_items.example_rewrite: Federated Anomaly Detection — Built privacy-preserving pipeline using TensorFlow Federated; integrated experiment tracking with [Tool] and validated model AUC on distributed datasets.

feedback_items.issue: Ownership and leadership details are sparse (no counts for engineers/volunteers, product/service ownership).
feedback_items.recommendation: Add brief statements of scope where accurate (e.g., 'owned CI/CD for X services' or 'led a team of Y volunteers'). Use placeholders if verifying later, but do not invent numbers.
feedback_items.example_rewrite: Owned CI/CD and deployments for X services across production and staging environments (confirm and replace X).

feedback_items.issue: Project entries lack links to code, demos, or documentation that would substantiate claims.
feedback_items.recommendation: Add GitHub/Colab/notebook links for projects you can share, or state 'private/restricted' where applicable to avoid confusion.
feedback_items.example_rewrite: Generative AI Gambling Help Chatbot (RWWA Hackathon) — Demo: github.com/your-repo (if public) or 'demo available on request'.

feedback_items.issue: Contact block lacks location and optional GitHub/portfolio link which help recruiter filtering.
feedback_items.recommendation: Add city/country and GitHub or portfolio link if available; keep the contact line single-line for ATS extraction.
feedback_items.example_rewrite: Rohit Sapkota | Perth, Australia | rohitsapkota1@gmail.com | (+61) 415 379 080 | linkedin.com/in/rohit-sapkota | github.com/your-username

feedback_items.issue: No Education section is present — absence can trigger recruiter questions even if not required.
feedback_items.recommendation: If you have relevant academic credentials, add a short Education section (degree, institution, year). If not applicable, consider an 'Additional training' line or omit entirely.
feedback_items.example_rewrite:
Education
B.Sc. Computer Science — [University Name], [Year] (add if applicable)

feedback_items.issue: Some bullets use passive phrasing or redundant terms (e.g., 'improving consistency, traceability, and deployment safety').
feedback_items.recommendation: Tighten bullets to active verbs and one clear outcome per line for faster skimming.
feedback_items.example_rewrite: Implemented Pulumi (TypeScript) IaC to standardise stacks, reducing configuration drift and improving rollback safety.

feedback_items.issue: Unicode characters and long inline qualification phrases in the original PDF can reduce ATS match-scores.
feedback_items.recommendation: Use plain ASCII punctuation, short keyword-rich phrases, and avoid long parenthetical lists in bullets; maintain one simple heading per section.
feedback_items.example_rewrite: CI/CD & Automation: GitHub Actions, GitLab, JFrog, AWX, pipeline design

feedback_items.issue: Certifications list is long and not prioritized — important AI/cloud certs get diluted among older entries.
feedback_items.recommendation: Group certifications into 'Key certifications' (AI, Cloud) and 'Additional certifications' (networking, courses) to highlight relevance to AI roles.
feedback_items.example_rewrite:
Key certifications
- AWS Certified AI Practitioner — AWS (Apr 2025)
- Deep Learning Specialisation — DeepLearning.AI (Oct 2025)

Additional certifications
- CCNA: Enterprise Networking — Cisco (Jun 2024)
- Foundations of Project Management — Google (Dec 2022)

applied_user_updates: Added a concise professional title line ('DevOps Engineer') beneath contact details.
Inserted a Skills / Technical Summary section with categorized, ATS-friendly keyword lists.
Normalized bullet formatting and removed excessive mid-sentence line breaks and special whitespace.
Standardized the Certifications section to one certification per line for improved readability and ATS parsing.
Reordered sections to: Skills, Experience, Projects, Certifications (improves recruiter scanning for technical roles).
